model_solution:
## Step 1: Multiply the numerator and the denominator by the conjugate of the denominator to rationalize it
$$\frac{8}{3\sqrt{3}+ 7\sqrt{27}}\cdot\frac{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}$$
## Step 2: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27})}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\sqrt{27})^2}$$
## Step 3: Simplify the denominator using the difference of squares formula
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27})}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\sqrt{27})^2} = \frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{3}\cdot3)}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\cdot3\sqrt{3})^2}$$
## Step 4: Simplify the expression in the denominator
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-21\sqrt{3})}{9(3) - 441 (3)}$$
## Step 5: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{8(-18\sqrt{3})}{-1296}$$
## Step 6: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{-144\sqrt{3}}{-1296}$$
## Step 7: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{1}{9\sqrt{3}}$$
## Step 8: To rationalize the denominator, multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt{3}$
$$\frac{1}{9\sqrt{3}}\cdot\frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}$$
## Step 9: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{9\cdot3}$$
## Step 10: Simplify the expression
$$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{27}$$
steps:
## Step 1: Multiply the numerator and the denominator by the conjugate of the denominator to rationalize it
$$\frac{8}{3\sqrt{3}+ 7\sqrt{27}}\cdot\frac{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}$$

## Step 3: Simplify the denominator using the difference of squares formula
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27})}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\sqrt{27})^2} = \frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{3}\cdot3)}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\cdot3\sqrt{3})^2}$$

## Step 4: Simplify the expression in the denominator
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-21\sqrt{3})}{9(3) - 441 (3)}$$

## Step 8: To rationalize the denominator, multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt{3}$
$$\frac{1}{9\sqrt{3}}\cdot\frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}$$
full_steps:
## Step 1: Multiply the numerator and the denominator by the conjugate of the denominator to rationalize it
$$\frac{8}{3\sqrt{3}+ 7\sqrt{27}}\cdot\frac{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}{3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27}}$$

## Step 3: Simplify the denominator using the difference of squares formula
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{27})}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\sqrt{27})^2} = \frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-7\sqrt{3}\cdot3)}{(3\sqrt{3})^2 - (7\cdot3\sqrt{3})^2}$$

## Step 4: Simplify the expression in the denominator
$$\frac{8(3\sqrt{3}-21\sqrt{3})}{9(3) - 441 (3)}$$

## Step 8: To rationalize the denominator, multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt{3}$
$$\frac{1}{9\sqrt{3}}\cdot\frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}$$
